title: Quichua Chimborazo - New Testament (Print)
description:
Kichwa (Kichwa shimi, Runashimi, also Spanish Quichua) is a Quechuan language that includes all Quechua varieties of Ecuador and Colombia (Inga), as well as extensions into Peru. It has an estimated half a million speakers.

The most widely spoken dialects are Chimborazo, Imbabura, and Cañar Highland Quechua, with most of the speakers. Kichwa belongs to the Northern Quechua group of Quechua II, according to linguist Alfredo Torero.

language.name: Chimborazo Highland Quichua
language.area: Central highlands, Chimborazo and Bolivar provinces.
